Class IntegerSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • IntegerSet

  • public class IntegerSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a set of integers using an array of booleans. Element i is true if integer i is in the set, false if it is not.
    Author:
    Andrew Goettler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean[] elementArray 
      (package private) int SET_SIZE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntegerSet()
      This method initializes the element array to an "empty set" of 100 elements set to false.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static IntegerSet complement(IntegerSet originalSet)
      This method generates the set-theoretic complement of the specified set.
      void deleteElement(int element)
      Removes an integer from the set by setting the specified element to false.
      boolean getElement(int element)
      This method indicates if a particular element is in the set.
      void insertElement(int element)
      Adds an integer to the set by setting the specified element to true.
      static IntegerSet intersection(IntegerSet setA, IntegerSet setB)
      This method generates the set-theoretic intersection of the specified pair of sets.
      boolean isEqualTo(IntegerSet otherSet)
      Compares the calling set to the specified set to determine if they are equivalent.
      private void modifyElement(int element, boolean value)
      This method sets the specified element in the set to the specified value.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the set as a list of numbers separated by spaces.
      static IntegerSet union(IntegerSet setA, IntegerSet setB)
      This method generates the set-theoretic union of the specified pair of sets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntegerSet

        public IntegerSet()
        This method initializes the element array to an "empty set" of 100 elements set to false.

    • Method Detail

      • union

        public static IntegerSet union(IntegerSet setA,
               IntegerSet setB)
        This method generates the set-theoretic union of the specified pair of sets. An element is in the returned set if it was in either or both of the specified sets.
        Parameters:
        setA -
        setB -
        Returns:
        the union of setA and setB

      • intersection

        public static IntegerSet intersection(IntegerSet setA,
                      IntegerSet setB)
        This method generates the set-theoretic intersection of the specified pair of sets. An element is in the returned set only if it was in both of the specified sets.
        Parameters:
        setA -
        setB -
        Returns:
        the intersection of setA and setB

      • complement

        public static IntegerSet complement(IntegerSet originalSet)
        This method generates the set-theoretic complement of the specified set. The complement of a set contains all of the elements not in the set.
        Parameters:
        originalSet -
        Returns:
        the complement of originalSet

      • getElement

        public boolean getElement(int element)
        This method indicates if a particular element is in the set.
        Parameters:
        element -
        Returns:
        true if the element is in the set, otherwise returns false

      • modifyElement

        private void modifyElement(int element,
                 boolean value)
        This method sets the specified element in the set to the specified value. It is a private method since all public insertions and removals to the set should be handled by the inserteElement and deleteElement methods, respectively.
        Parameters:
        element -
        value -

      • insertElement

        public void insertElement(int element)
        Adds an integer to the set by setting the specified element to true.
        Parameters:
        element - integer to be inserted into the set

      • deleteElement

        public void deleteElement(int element)
        Removes an integer from the set by setting the specified element to false.
        Parameters:
        element - integer to be removed from the set

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo(IntegerSet otherSet)
        Compares the calling set to the specified set to determine if they are equivalent.
        Parameters:
        otherSet - the set to be compared
        Returns:
        true if sets are equivalent, otherwise returns false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the set as a list of numbers separated by spaces. Only the integers present in the set are included; the empty set is represent as {---}.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
